official-title.#text: To require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives December 11, 2014.

header.#text: Study of electric rates in the insular areas

text.#text: In this section:

term.#tail: means a comprehensive energy plan prepared and updated under

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes/s:604/ss:c
An Act to authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes/s:604/ss:e

quote.#text: An Act to authorize appropriations for certain insular areas of the United States, and for other purposes

term.#tail: means the plan required by subsection (d).

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Federated States of Micronesia, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Republic of Palau.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Virgin Islands.

text.#text: The term
The term

term.#tail: means the team established by the

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, within the Empowering Insular Communities activity, establish a team of technical, policy, and financial experts—

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
to develop an energy action plan addressing the energy needs of each of the insular areas and Freely Associated States; and
to assist each of the insular areas and Freely Associated States in implementing such plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consider including regional utility organizations.

text.#text: In establishing the team, the
In accordance with subsection (b), the energy action plan shall include—
recommendations, based on the comprehensive energy plan where applicable, to—
reduce reliance and expenditures on fuel shipped to the insular areas and Freely Associated States from ports outside the United States;
develop and utilize domestic fuel energy sources; and
improve performance of energy infrastructure and overall energy efficiency;
a schedule for implementation of such recommendations and identification and prioritization of specific projects;
a financial and engineering plan for implementing and sustaining projects; and
benchmarks for measuring progress toward implementation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: establishes the team and annually thereafter, the team shall submit to the
a report detailing progress made in fulfilling its charge and in implementing the energy action plan.

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date on which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: receives a report submitted by the team under subsection (e), the
shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a summary of the report of the team.

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date on which the
The energy action plan shall not be implemented until the

header.#text: Amendments to the consolidated natural resources act

quote.#text: December 31, 2014, except as provided in subsections (b) and (d)

text.#text: in subsection (a)(2), by striking
in subsection (d)—

quote.#text: not to extend beyond December 31, 2014, unless extended pursuant to paragraph 5 of this subsection

text.#text: in the third sentence of paragraph (2), by striking
by striking paragraph (5); and
by redesignating paragraph (6) as paragraph (5).

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5803 EH: To require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes.
